intro.text:
Language Processing Laboratory

Department of Linguistics, The University of Chicago

Thank you for your interest in our study!

As a reminder, this study runs best in Chrome or Firefox. If you are not using one of these browers, we recommend switching now to avoid future issues. When you are ready, please proceed by pressing the space bar.

consent.requirements: You must be at least 18 years old to participate in this study.
consent.purpose: In this research, we are investigating the processes involved in the comprehension of sentences.
consent.procedures: In this study, you will be presented with sets of shapes and determine whether statements about them are true or false.
consent.name: Dr. Ming Xiang

timeline.text:
Thank you for considering participation in this study!

We"re sorry it wasn"t for you. You may close this window and return your HIT. There is no penalty for returning our lab"s HITs.

post_demographics.text:
Thank you for deciding to participate in our study!

In this experiment, each question will present you with a set of images. Take a moment to study the images, especially the images surrounded by a rectangular frame. After a few seconds, a sentence will appear beneath the images. Your task is to decide whether the sentence is "true" or "false" based on the images you see.

If the content of the sentence is compatible with what the images show, then it is "True"; otherwise it is "False".

To try some practice questions, please press the space bar.
